metadata.title: CVE-2018-12028 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: An Incorrect Access Control vulnerability in SpawningKit in PhusionPassenger 5.3.x before 5.3.2 allows a Passenger-managed maliciousapplication, upon spawning a child process, to report an arbitrarydifferent PID back to Passenger's process manager. If the maliciousapplication then generates an error, it would cause Passenger's processmanager to kill said reported arbitrary PID.

criterions.comment: ruby-passenger: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
